selected_quotes: The Grand Canyon may be nearly 60 million years older than previously thought
With one report, the Grand Canyon ages 60 million years #geology
I have a story coming up soon on this new paper saying Grand Canyon is 70 million not 6 million years old

citation.abstract: The Grand Canyon is one of the most dramatic features on Earth, yet when and why it was carved have been controversial topics for more than 150 years. Here, we present apatite (4)He/(3)He thermochronometry data from the Grand Canyon basement that tightly constrain the near-surface cooling history associated with canyon incision. (4)He/(3)He spectra for eastern Grand Canyon apatites of differing He date, radiation damage, and U-Th zonation yield a self-consistent cooling history that substantially validates the He diffusion kinetic model applied here. Similar data for the western Grand Canyon provide evidence that it was excavated to within a few hundred meters of modern depths by ~70 million years ago (Ma), in contrast to the conventional model in which the entire canyon was carved since 5 to 6 Ma.
citation.publisher: American Association for the Advancement of Science
citation.title: Apatite 4He/3He and (U-Th)/He Evidence for an Ancient Grand Canyon.

news.title: Neue Gesteinsanalyse: Grand Canyon entstand wohl schon zur Saurier-Zeit
news.summary: Gab es Dinos am Grand Canyon? Einer neuen Analyse zufolge sind Teile der großen Schlucht in Arizona schon vor 70 Millionen Jahren entstanden - und damit erheblich älter als bisher gedacht.

news.title: Study contends Grand Canyon as old as dinosaur era
news.summary: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The awe-inspiring Grand Canyon was probably carved about 70 million years ago, much earlier than thought, a provocative new study suggests — so early that dinosaurs might have roamed near this natural wonder.

news.title: Study challenges presumed age of Grand Canyon

news.title: Grand Canyon is actually 65million years older than thought
news.summary: Most previous estimates have put its age at 5 million to 6 million years, based on the age of gravel washed downstream by the ancestral Colorado River.

news.title: Grand Canyon as old as the dinosaurs, suggests new study led by CU-Boulder
Grand Canyon is not so ancient
news.summary: Parts of famous chasm are tens of millions of years old, but integration happened more recently.

news.title: Debate Over Grand Canyon's Age May Finally Be Over
news.summary: A longstanding geological fight over the age of one of the most iconic landscapes in the United States — Arizona's Grand Canyon — may finally be over. The massive chasm does not date back 70 million years, as earlier work had suggested, but was born in its

news.title: Grand Canyon: University Claims Not so Old
news.summary: The Grand Canyon, according to researchers at the University of New Mexico, is not nearly so old as generally presumed. The canyon runs 277 miles through the state of Arizona, 18 miles across at its widest and a staggering 6,000 feet in depth. One of the g

news.title: Geschichte des Grand Canyon: Schlucht der Dinos
news.summary: Nicht fünf Millionen Jahre ist der Grand Canyon alt, sondern stolze 70 Millionen. US-Forscher haben Hinweise darauf entdeckt, dass die Schlucht in zwei Schritten entstanden ist. Der erste begann demnach, als die Dinosaurier noch existierten.

news.title: Datierung: Fluss-Durchbruch öffnete Grand Canyon
news.summary: Wie entstand der Grand Canyon, eine der größten Schluchten der Erde? Datierungen des Gesteins zeigen, dass offenbar erst ein Durchbruch des kleinen Colorado-Flusses den weltberühmten Graben komplettierte.
